intro: Licania celativenia, commonly known as the hidden beauty vine, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and white, typically arranged in clusters, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Licania celativenia is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
